posts.raw_content:
If you had asked me, in the darkest days of the Biden administration, if I thought we could get back here, back into power, with Trump vindicated, restored to office...well, I wouldn't have TOLD you no, because doomerism is contagious, but I sure would have thought it.

The whole thing seemed so insurmountable.  When even with Trump in power, the Democrats, the deep state, China, all the powers arrayed against us had literally released a plague, turned 2020 into one hell after another, the worst year of any of our lives, all to get Trump.  Then rigged an election, almost in plain sight, and NOTHING was done.  Even when they got caught.  Even when it was completely proven the intel community conspired with the press and big tech to censor Biden's scandals.  Then they did it again in 2022.  Oops the machines broke, sorry, Kari Lake lost!

Censored everywhere on the internet, Trump being indicted...I was sure they were gonna throw his ass in prison...our rioters rotting in gulags while their rioters were treated like heroes...a kid on trial for his life for defending himself even though we could all watch on video as an armed mob chased him and tried to beat him to death, all of our leaders being investigated, all of our public figures being cancelled, everything woke nonstop, and nobody could seem to push back at all and get any traction.

Biden could randomly tell reporters his butt had been wiped and wander off aimlessly in a random direction, and they'd tell the public his senility was a conspiracy theory and the public would believe it.

I thought we were fucked.  I thought this country was fucked.  And frankly the only reason I didn't say we'd just completely lost and may as well give up was I figured I'd get banned for being a shill if I did and I didn't want to lose the last place where I could vent about how shitty everything was without being censored or called a Nazi.

But somehow, SOMEHOW...we overcame all of that.  Every dirty trick they could possibly pull.  Arrests, convictions, candidate switches, rigged debates, ballot removal, disqualification attempts, BULLETS.  There was NOTHING they didn't try, no length they didn't go to.  And we still won.  The magnitude of it...is staggering.  You don't believe that Hollywood-style stories where the band of plucky, persecuted outsiders topple the all-powerful regime that has every possible advantage and total control of everything happen in real life but it did.  A bearded good 'ol boy, a sperglord rich guy, a podcaster on shrooms, a crazy liberal ranting about vaccines, and a bunch of meatheads from UFC and pro wrestling can't possibly beat the whole government, the whole financial sector, the whole media, and all of Hollywood at once, and make an elderly eccentric comedian President even with a felony conviction, right?  And yet...here we are.

The average member of the public turned out to be so much smarter than I ever gave them credit for.  So many people successfully saw through so much bullshit repeated at them so many times.  Halle-fucking-lujah.  One of the greatest political turning points, and one of the most unlikely, in human history, and WE did it.  Our generations, our movement, our nation, our people.  Thousands of years from now they'll still be teaching kids about what happened.  About what WE did.
posts.author: DonttrustChina
posts.title: Sometimes I still can't get my head around the fact we won, and what we managed to win OVER.

If you had asked me, in the darkest days of the Biden administration, if I thought we could get back here, back into power, with Trump vindicated, restored to office...well, I wouldn't have TOLD you no, because doomerism is contagious, but I sure would have thought it.

A bearded good 'ol boy, a sperglord rich guy, a podcaster on shrooms, a crazy liberal ranting about vaccines, and a bunch of meatheads from UFC and pro wrestling can't possibly beat the whole government, the whole financial sector, the whole media, and all of Hollywood at once, and make an elderly eccentric comedian President even with a felony conviction, right? Halle-fucking-lujah. One of the greatest political turning points, and one of the most unlikely, in human history, and WE did it. Our generations, our movement, our nation, our people. Thousands of years from now they'll still be teaching kids about what happened. About what WE did.
